author: GlasierXplor
comment: You do have to write reports throughout your 3 years so English is still important somewhat.. even if you have good content, bad grammar can make the content lose it's meaning. if you really want to improve without affecting your GPA, find a short course like English for Business or something. No shame in wanting to be better lol

```json
  "sentiment": "neutral",
  "topics": ["academic", "English language proficiency"],

  "suggestions": ["Taking a short course in English for Business to improve writing skills without impacting GPA"]
}
```

author: mount2010
comment: If you are doing PFP you probably will have English, not from PFP so can't comment. Otherwise poly courses don't really care/focus directly on English anymore. But TP has "TPFun" general education courses with essay writing required sometimes so you still need some essay writing skills.

author: blackrosethorn3
comment: Y1 doesn't have English but TP has free Grammarly subscription. I suggest you use chatgpt to check ur language too

author: PandAMonierm
comment: If your English isn't at least mid - as in, it really sucks - then I think you're better off taking some short courses on English. Because you'll want to at least be decent at it throughout poly and beyond.
